title: [QUESTION] VirusTotal says that libSkiaSharp.framework has: Trojan:Script/Wacatac.C!ml
body:
I've just noticed that Microsoft scanner in VirusTotal reports that libSkiaSharp.framework which is included in SkiaSharp (2.80.1) package contains `Trojan:Script/Wacatac.C!ml`. I know it's strange but Facebook recently blocked one of my dev accounts because my app contains malware. 

The funny thing that other Antiviruses didn't detect anything and I think it's false-positive report but Facebook mentioned that they will unblock it once VirusTotal doesn't detect anything.

The current report is:
https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/9ff0ecec52a936c6b1135c508d6794c4913f73d0988e544f6119e3f5e5d039b0/detection

It could be reproduced by adding SkiaSharp into a project and create IPA. Then you can submit IPA into https://www.virustotal.com/gui/

Once SkiaSharp is removed from the project then Microsoft scanner doesn't detect anything.
